Senior Workflow & Project Team Lead Google April 2014  –  April 2015  (1 year 1 month) Dublin Full end-to-end responsibility of global Special Projects and HC allocation of 400+ Dublin based operators across 17 workflows in 23 markets. Goal is to improve the quality and coverage of diverse points of interest on Google Maps. Representing EMEA & LATAM while liaising with Senior Management as well as external teams in Mountain View, Hyderabad, Beijing, New York. 
 
ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDE 
- Conceptualized, set up, trained, staffed, analyzed, summarized and presented results of over 150 projects globally 
- Conceptualized and rolled out new methods to track operator’s quality and productivity in these projects increasing output quality by ~7% 
- Increased staffing efficiency and effectiveness through the creation of database dashboards, project trackers and staffing check-ins, liaising with 20 Team Leads in Dublin 
- Played vital part in increasing site quality from ~92% to +98% 
- Contributed to site culture through creating videos and events 
 
PROJECTS SET UP AND LED 
- New global CSAT program increasing call quality for our 1.5k HC strong operation, implemented in LDO metrics 
- Strategic sweeps to tackle identified issues: 1.3k listings with identical map location in Ireland, 300 hospitals in Turkey, 950 governmental listings in Belgium 
- Dublin's portion of data collection and - verification of over 1k global Prominent Places 
- Verification of 21k strategic listings in Turkey, Argentina and Poland increasing location and address accuracy by 70% and over 40% improvement of other attributes such as title and phone number 
- 5k+ relevant business listings ahead of the 2014 FIFA World Cup in Brazil, increasing quality to over 98% 
- ‘Mixed Edits’ operations: responsible for daily worksheets, reporting on progress, follow up with technical and policy issues, weekly meetings 
- 'Indoor' operations: created a new workflow aimed at creation and updating of POIs inside top level business listings such as shopping malls and airports Technical Support Specialist and Global Escalations Investigator Google July 2013  –  April 2014  (10 months) Dublin After 3 months in Google Maps, I got promoted to a Tool Point Of Contact (POC) position. Responsibilities in this role include: 
Solving ad hoc issues with the tools of operators on site,  
Discovering trends in these issues and communicating them to on-site functional leads and global engineers,  
Heuristic testing of new software,  
Communicating common problems and workarounds to the operators on site,  
Managing access rights for different roles on site (quality control, management, ...),  
Streamlining on-site communication e.g. through building an internal web platform, 
and more. 
 
In this role I'm getting the chance to gain more insight in the workings of the broad global project that is Google Maps. I'm applying creative problem solving on a daily basis, while constantly improving both my communicational and analytical skills. Local Data Evaluator Google April 2013  –  March 2014  (1 year) Dublin Evaluated Google Maps data for the Dutch and Belgian market, as well as high profile listings around the world. 
To insure the best Google Maps user experience possible, accurate and complete data is critical.  
My job was to review data from different inputs and to verify and complete it using various sources with great attention to detail in a target driven international environment.  
 
- Highest performer on site in 2 months’ time, consistently exceeded challenging daily targets of 60+ listings with a quality score of above 98%

Webmaster bostekoop.nl July 2010  –  January 2013  (2 years 7 months) Developed Bostekoop.nl , a consumer-facing website to sell and buy forests. Aside from adapting the WordPress-framework to the customer’s needs, I developed a custom CMS to intuitively handle the data in custom made databases. 
It is now a successful online platform for buying and selling forests, with a turn around of over 300 forests (beginning of 2015), 100+ unique visitors a day from 15+ countries. Summary I'm passionate about developing people and organizations. I currently put that passion to work for Google as a People Development Business Partner supporting an emerging and strategic part of Google's business organization. 
 
My current role includes consulting with senior stakeholders, working with HRBP's to build and execute people plans and developing large-scale change efforts to drive sales, build great managers, leaders and teams and motivate employees to meet the challenges of working in a dynamic, competitive high-tech environment. 
 
Outside of my core job, I support Googlers as an internal coach (we call them Career Gurus). I provide guidance on a variety of work-related topics including exploring new career opportunities, navigating company culture, developing new skills, sustaining high-performance, improving communication and having more productive interactions with coworkers. Search for more info: career guru google.
